column2: On the Fourth of July, 1806 We set sail from the sweet Cobh of Cork
The wind was whipping shingle through the windows in the town A hail of stones across the roof, the slates came raining down
It was christmas eve babe In the drunk tank An old man said to me: won't see another one And then they sang a song
Billy ran around with the rare old crew And he knew an arsenal from tottenham blue
